text: Hi Peter if I'm understanding the doc correctly it looks like you have a column inside a column I don't think your suppose to do that it should be a row with columns is how I understand it.
A row can have column and columns can have rows but a column can't have a column inside it.

Hi Thomas, thank you for taking a look at this for me and sharing the dnd structure graphic. I have been using this graphic as a guide and I think I have built something very much like it in my template. Note in the graphic there are two rows under the first column, the second one of which contains another column. Am I seeing this right?
I should also point out the internal columns in my design are contained within their own row which, per the graphic, should be ok.

hi guys, do you have any idea why the redirect url brings it to me as null?
in the form I choose without problem which will be the thank you page but it brings it to me as null
Yes that is how I understand it. A column can have a row that has a column.
Ok so you have 2 columns on top of each other on the right side in your graphic but you have the second column 3 wide and offset by 9 wouldn't that should stack them next to each other like this?
In your desired image it looks like you want that column 6 wide.

Your rendition is a good bridge between my spreadsheet which shows how I coded the template and how I want it to look  as a page. Bear in mind, I'm using the following notation for the columns:

column(x,y) where x = offset, y = width

The image you created is exactly what I want to accomplish: the turquoise area containing two columns side-by-side under the "we help to" row.

The left column would be 3 segments wide containing the mustard circle, and the right one would be  9 wide containing the lorem ipsum text. I don't understand why they are stacked.
Yes I have that colored in reverse 9,3
